thread.title: How falling oil prices affect Aberdeen and UK economy
thread.title_full: How falling oil prices affect Aberdeen and UK economy - BBC News

author: BBC
title: How falling oil prices affect Aberdeen and UK economy
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device How falling oil prices affect Aberdeen and UK economy 16 October 2015 Last updated at 14:57 BST
In the run-up to the independence referendum, voters were told an independent Scotland would be quids in with revenues flowing from North Sea Oil.
But the current barrel of oil is selling for less than half the $100 dollar estimate and drilling is more expensive than ever.
Adam Fleming reports from Aberdeen, home to the UK's oil industry and venue for the SNP conference, on the effects of failing prices.
Read more Daily Politics and Sunday Politics highlights of 2015
